general.success.aendereadresse.1:
Changing your home address can have the following repercussions:
- Your insurance premium could be adjusted
- Elements of your GP model (e.g. BenefitPLUS) could be adjusted
- The composition of your policy could be adjusted (collation or separation of individual policies)

Our service staff will contact you if necessary.

Our service staff will contact you if necessary.

help.common.contact: Should you require further information on the myHelsana client portal, please do not hesitate to contact us. We can provide support on problems to do with registration, signing in, navigating the portal, changing passwords and co-browsing, etc.
help.index.title: General questions on myHelsana
help.index.question.2.content_html: No, it is not possible to deactivate notifications. They are an important medium for us to alert you to new information appearing in myHelsana (e.g. new documents, general news).
help.index.question.3.content_html: We do not store personal information. Helsana uses GoogleAnalytics to monitor site usage. To do this, we need to identify your IP address. However, Google's data-protection guidelines explicitly state that Analytics does not establish any links to personal data (e.g. Gmail).
help.index.question.4: Is my data secure with Helsana?
help.index.question.4.content_html: Yes, Helsana has taken organisational and technical steps to ensure that your personal data is protected against unauthorised access.
help.index.question.5: Where can I find the legal information relating to myHelsana?
help.index.question.5.content_html: The terms of use for myHelsana can be found at: terms of use.
help.index.question.6: Who can provide me with help when I need it?
help.index.question.6.content_html:
Should you have any questions on myHelsana or need practical assistance (online help), you can reach us on the following telephone numbers:

058 340 93 70

When phoning from abroad: +41 58 340 18 80

These telephone numbers are intended for use specifically for issues concerning the myHelsana client portal.

Should you have any general questions on your health insurance, please call us on 0844 80 81 82 as usual.
help.index.question.6.content[staff]_htm:
Should you have any questions on myHelsana or need practical assistance (online help), you can reach us on the following telephone number:

058 340 12 26
help.personal.title: Amendments to personal data
help.personal.title.sub: (personal details, contact data, addresses, payment details)
help.personal.question.1: What data can I manage myself on the portal?
help.personal.question.1.content_html:
myHelsana categorises client data by personal details (e.g. name, date of birth), contact data (e.g. telephone no.), address (residential addresses), in-payments and out-payments (type of payment, frequency, bank details) and myHelsana account (mobile number for mTan, user name and password).

You are free to modify each of these areas separately. Simply click on "Edit" to display the relevant content for editing. Content that cannot be modified via myHelsana is highlighted accordingly. If you want to change any of these items, simply post a message to myHelsana or give us a call. Our service staff will be happy to deal with your query.
help.conversation.title: Questions on Messages
help.conversation.question.1: Things to note when posting messages to myHelsana?
help.conversation.question.1.content_htm:
We are happy to receive your messages on myHelsana. When you click on "Write message", please state clearly in the subject line whether this a general message or a complaint. Feel free to send us your messages/queries concerning documents and orders in the order journal via myHelsana.
The answer to your query will appear in myHelsana under "Messages". An e-mail alerting you to our reply will also be sent to the address you gave us when you registered with us.

Any unread messages will appear in bold.

You can also upload documents to support your query. You must send these documents (attachments) in PDF format. Attachments must not exceed 5 MB in size.
help.document.title: Questions on documents
help.document.question.1: Things to note concerning documents in myHelsana
help.document.question.1.content_html: Once you have completed the registration process by entering your activation code, you will receive your mail electronically via myHelsana. This means that premium invoices, insurance policies, annual tax statements and benefit statements, etc. will all be stored in your myHelsana account. You will receive physical post only when this is a legal requirement, or for technical reasons.

payment.incoming.zahlungsart.info_html:
You want to change the way you make payments? You can generate forms for your direct debits ("LSV") with a bank ("Debit Direct" or "DD" for PostFinance customers), or obtain information on e-billing here.
IMPORTANT: We can help you prepare your digital payment options here. With all three processes ("LSV", "DD" and e-billing), you will need to perform the final steps at your bank or PostFinance branch.

Different payment accounts exist for your policies. For this reason, we cannot show you any details.
If you want to use the same payment account for all your policies, please send us a message.
payment.type.hint.ASR_EXISTS_POLICY:
You have not created a payment account for one or more of your policies.
Please create a payment account to save you the CHF 20 payment charge.
Should you have any queries concerning this matter, please send us a message.
payment.type.hint.RHYTHM_DIFFERENT:
You have arranged different payment frequencies for your policies. For this reason, we cannot show you any details.
If you wish to adjust your payment rates frequencies or have any queries concerning this matter, please send us a message.
payment.ebill.info_html:
1. Sign in to your e-banking/e-finance application.
  2. Choose the "e-billing" menu item.
  3. If you have not yet registered: activate the e-billing function in your bank's e-banking application or in PostFinance's e-finance application.
  4. Choose your Helsana-Group health insurer from the list of payees and follow the instructions (you only need do this once).
payment.rhythm.title: Change of payment frequency
payment.rhythm.info_html:
The payment frequency will be adjusted to the next possible date.
Until then, the payments will continue to be made with the current frequency.

personal.hint.zahlungsrhythmus.1: Should you have any queries concerning your payment frequency or wish to modify it, please send us a message or phone us on 0844 80 81 82.
personal.hint.zahlungsrhythmus.1[staff]: Should you have any queries concerning your payment frequency or wish to modify it, please send us a message or phone us on 058 340 12 26.
personal.hint.zahlungsrhythmus.2_html: You can pay your premium on a monthly, two-monthly, quarterly, semi-annual or annual basis. We grant 0.5% discount on semi-annual payments and a full 1% on annual payments.
personal.hint.zahlungsart_html: What options do you have for the cost sharing and premium payments? What's your advantage and disadvantage and is there a chance to get any discounts? You will find the information here.
personal.contract.title: Contract
personal.franchise.title: Deductible
personal.franchise.info: Please bear in mind that in case of accident or illness the entire deductible as well as the excess of 10% (maximally CHF 700 per calendar year) must be paid by you.
personal.franchise.info2_html: Unfortunately the maximum allowed deductible discount cannot always be exhausted completely. The law requires that the reduced premium be no more than 50% cheaper than the basic premium with accident coverage and the minimum statutory deductible.
personal.accident.title: Accident
personal.accident.info: As soon as you are appointed with the same employer for at least 8 hours per week, you are automatically insured against occupational and non-occupational accidents by them. The accident insurance of your employer will then cover these treatment costs.
personal.contact.info.favor.text: Since your mobile number and email address are used for the registration these can only be changed via the settings.
setting.hint.mtan: When you sign in, your transaction number (Tan) will be sent to this mobile phone number.
setting.hint.kuenden: If you no longer wish to use myHelsana, you will need to close your myHelsana account. Until then, the terms of use for myHelsana will continue to apply.
setting.hint.benutzername: The user name matches the e-mail address you gave
setting.cancel.title: Close myHelsana account
setting.cancel.info:
To close your myHelsana account, please call us on one of the numbers shown below, Monday to Friday, from 8 am to 6 pm:

058 340 93 70

When calling from abroad:
+41 58 340 18 80
Monday to Friday, from 8 am to 5 pm.

IMPORTANT: Please make sure you save all your important documents and messages (locally to your PC, or by printing them out), as you will not be able to access your account once it has been closed.

Once your account has been closed, you will receive all your documents by ordinary post again.
setting.cancel.info[staff]:
To close your myHelsana account, please call us on one of the numbers shown below, Monday to Friday, from 8 am to 6 pm:

058 340 12 26

IMPORTANT: Please make sure you save all your important documents and messages (locally to your PC, or by printing them out), as you will not be able to access your account once it has been closed.

Once your account has been closed, you will receive all your documents by ordinary post again.
